intro: Christia translucida, commonly known as the translucent sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and narrow, translucent leaves that give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks. Christia translucida is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its unique foliage.
